The Firm, with its experienced staff of engineers, surveyors and support personnel, provides our clients with such specific personalized services as the following:


LAND SURVEYING:

  1. •Boundary surveys

  2. •Topographic surveys

  3. •ALTA Surveys

  4. •Property line determinations

  5. •Mortgage surveys

  6. •Horizontal and vertical control surveys for aerial photogrammetry

  7. •Residential, commercial and industrial subdivision planning and design

  8. •Lot pinning

  9. •Construction stakeout of buildings, roads, parking lots, storm drains, utilities and septic systems

  10. •As-built surveys


CIVIL ENGINEERING AND PLANNING:

  1. •Land use planning and feasibility analysis

  2. •Residential, commercial and industrial subdivision site development design

  3. •Active adult, condominium and apartment community site development design

  4. •Residential, commercial, industrial and institutional Site Development Plans

  5. •Storm water management, sanitary sewer and water supply system analysis and design

  6. •Hydraulic and hydrological analysis and design

  7. •Soil testing and analysis

  8. •On-site subsurface sewage disposal system design

  9. •Road and driveway design

  10. •Erosion and sediment control design and plans

  11. •Preparation of applications and supporting data for State Department of Environmental Protection, State Department of Transportation, and Federal U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Wetlands Permits

  12. •Preparation of Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans for construction and industrial activities

  13. •Preparation of design plans and written specifications and project manuals for competitive bidding and assistance with bid evaluation

  14. •Preparation of quantity and cost estimates for proposed construction

  15. •Construction engineering and inspection services 

  16. •Land use planning and design consultation


To best provide the most effective and accurate execution of the work for its clients, Messier & Associates, Inc. is equipped with leading edge electronic and computer hardware and software for surveying, engineering, drafting and office activities, including electronic total stations, data collectors and laptop computers for field surveying activities, and Autodesk AutoCAD® and Land Desktop Development Civil/Survey application software and hydrologic/hydraulic software programs for survey and engineering computations and plan generation.  All original plans prepared by the Firm are produced using a networked in-house computer system and plotters.  Reports, specifications and other written materials are produced using computer desk top publishing and printing.
